1109.01
Fees for zoning certificates - see P. & Z.
1109.02
Fees for building permits - see P. & Z.
1113.02(e)
 
 
1305.01 SURVEYOR OR ENGINEER CERTIFICATION BEFORE PERMIT ISSUANCE.
   All corner pins of a lot or lots upon which a building is to be constructed
shall be set by a registered surveyor or civil engineer before a permit is
issued for construction of the building.
   All buildings to be erected within the Municipality shall be staked out by a
registered surveyor or civil engineer, and the registered surveyor or civil
engineer shall certify that the building has been so placed within the lot or
lots to comply with the Zoning Ordinance with regard to proper setback and
sideyard distances.
(Ord. 875-62. Passed 4-17-62.)
1305.02 WORK TO CONFORM WITH PLANS AND SPECIFICATIONS.
   The erection and repairs, additions or alterations for which a building
permit is issued, must be erected or made in strict conformance with the plans,
specifications or other information furnished to the Building Inspector.
(1940 Code §147)
1305.03 BUILDING WITHOUT PERMIT.
   (a)   No person shall erect, repair, make additions to or alter any building
or structure without first having obtained a building permit from the Building
Inspector.
   
   (b)   Any person who violates this section shall be subject to the penalty
as provided in Section
1301.99 and shall be required to comply with this section and pay one hundred
dollars ($100.00).
1305.04 APPEALS FROM DECISION OF BUILDING INSPECTOR.
   If any person feels aggrieved at any decision of the Building Inspector, an
appeal may be made by such person within twenty days to the Board of Zoning
Appeals.
1305.05 CERTIFICATE OF USE AND OCCUPANCY.
   (a)   New Buildings. A building or structure hereafter erected shall not be
used or occupied in whole or in part until the Certificate of Use and Occupancy
shall have been issued by the Zoning Inspector. Such Certificate of Use of
Occupancy shall not be issued until water and sewer connections have been
approved by the Village Administrator.
   (b)   Buildings Hereafter Altered. A building or structure hereafter
enlarged, extended or altered, in whole or in part, shall not be occupied or
used until the Certificate of Use and Occupancy shall have been issued; except
that any use or occupancy which was not discontinued during the work or
alteration shall require the issuance of a Certificate by the Zoning Inspector
within thirty days after completion of the alteration. Such Certificate of Use
and Occupancy shall not be issued until water and sewer connections have been
approved by the Village Administrator.
   (c)   Temporary Occupancy. Upon request of the holder of a permit, the
Zoning Inspector may issue a temporary Certificate of Use and Occupancy for a
building or structure, or part thereof, before work covered by the permit shall
have been completed, provided such portion or portions may be occupied safely
prior to full completion of the building or structure without endangering life
or welfare.
   (d)   When a building or structure is entitled thereto, the Zoning Inspector
shall issue a Certificate of Use and Occupancy. The certificate shall certify
compliance with the provisions of all ordinances. (Ord. 2718-96. Passed 4-17-
96.)
1305.99 PENALTY.
   (EDITOR’S NOTE: See Section
1301.99 for general Building Code penalty.)

CHAPTER 1313
Ohio Building Code
1313.01   Adoption.
1313.02   Effective date.
1313.03   Enforcement.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Adoption of technical codes by reference - see Ohio R.C. 731.231

715.261
 
 
1313.01 ADOPTION.
   Ohio Administrative Code Section 4101:1 - the Ohio Building Code, Ohio
Administrative Code 4101:2 - the Ohio Mechanical Code, and Ohio Administrative
Code 4101:3 - the Ohio Plumbing Code, as promulgated by the Ohio Board of
Building Standards, shall apply and be enforced within the Village of McDonald,
Ohio.
(Ord. 3157-14. Passed 5-7-14.)
1313.02 EFFECTIVE DATE.
   This Chapter shall be in full force and effect from and after the earliest
period permitted by law following promulgation of the Ohio Building Code, Ohio
Mechanical Code, and Ohio Plumbing Code, by the Board of Building Standards
through the certification process, adoption and effective date of certification
issued by the Ohio Board of Building Standards.
(Ord. 3157-14. Passed 5-7-14.)
1313.03 ENFORCEMENT.
   (a)   The Mayor and Fiscal Officer are hereby authorized and directed to
sign and submit an application to the Ohio Board of Building Standards,
requesting said Board to certify the Village of McDonald, Ohio for enforcement
of the Ohio Building Code and Ohio Mechanical Code, with the condition that the
Trumbull County Building Department exercise the enforcement authority, as
necessary, in accordance with Ohio Building Code and Ohio Mechanical Code for
nonresidential buildings within the limits of said Village of McDonald and to
enter into agreement with Trumbull County Building Department for such purpose.
Further, the Trumbull County Board of Health already enforces the Ohio Plumbing
Code within the Village and performs plumbing inspections on all buildings.
   (b)   The Village, through its Mayor and its Fiscal Officer, are hereby
authorized and directed to enter into an agreement with Trumbull County for the
enforcement of the Ohio Building Code and Ohio Mechanical Code for
nonresidential buildings within the limits of said Village, whereby the
Trumbull County Building Department will exercise all enforcement authority and
accept and approve plans and specifications and make inspections necessary
within said Village in accordance with the provisions of the Ohio Building Code
and Ohio Mechanical Code for all nonresidential buildings. The terms of said
agreement shall grant Trumbull County full authority to do all things necessary
to administer and enforce the Ohio Building Code and Ohio Mechanical Code for
nonresidential buildings within the limits of the Village of McDonald and, in
consideration therefore, to allow Trumbull County to retain all permit and
inspection fees authorized by the State of Ohio for such purposes.
(Ord. 3157-14. Passed 5-7-14.)
 
CHAPTER 1317
National Electrical Code
1317.01   Adoption.
1317.02   File and distribution copies.
1317.03   Amendments.
1317.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Power to license electricians - see Ohio R.C. 715.27
Adoption of technical codes - see Ohio R.C. 731.231
Trumbull County Building Code - see BLDG. Ch.
1313
 
 
1317.01 ADOPTION.
   There is hereby adopted, and incorporated by reference as if fully set out
at length herein, for the purpose of establishing standards for electrical
materials and installations in all structures, that certain code known as the
National Electrical Code, 1984 edition, recommended by the National Fire
Protection Association, subject to the modifications provided under Section
1317.03.
1317.02 FILE AND DISTRIBUTION COPIES.
   Copies of the National Electrical Code adopted herein are on file with the
Village Clerk for inspection by the public and in the County Law Library. The
Village Clerk also has copies available for distribution to the public at cost.
1317.03 AMENDMENTS.
   For the purpose of establishing standards for electrical materials and
installations in residential buildings and one, two and three-family
industrialized dwelling houses, the National Electrical Code adopted herein is
modified by the amendment of the following sections as respectively indicated
to conform with Chapters 53 and 75 of the Ohio Building Code.
NEC Section 215-2. Minimum Rating and Size. (Amended)
   Feeder conductors shall have a current rating not smaller than the feeder
load as determined by Article 220. A 2-wire feeder supplying two or more 2-wire
branch circuits, or a 3-wire feeder supplying more than two, 2-wire branch
circuits, or two or more 3-wire branch circuits shall be not smaller than No.
10 except as follows:
   Exception. In a multi-family dwelling, each individual apartment of two or
more habitable rooms shall be provided with a feeder sized in accordance with
Article 220 but in no case shall the feeder be smaller than 60 ampere, 3-wire.
NEC Section 230-79. Rating of Disconnect. (Amended)
   The service equipment shall have a rating not less than the load to be
carried determined in accordance with Article 220. The service disconnecting
means shall have a rating of not less than 60 amperes except:
   Exception No. 1: For all dwelling units, the service equipment shall have a
rating of not less than 100 amperes. Where multiple switches or circuit
breakers are used in accordance with Section 230-70(g) this service equipment
shall provide a minimum of 100 amperes of connected overcurrent protection
consisting of not less than two 50 ampere, 250 volt, two-pole overcurrent
devices.
   Exception No. 2: For installations consisting of not more than two 2-wire
branch circuits a service equipment of 30-ampere minimum rating may be used.
1317.99 PENALTY.
   (EDITOR'S NOTE: See Section
1301.99 for general Building Code penalty.)

1325.13   Future signs.

CROSS REFERENCES

1113.02(e)
 
 
1325.01 PURPOSE.
   The purpose of this chapter is to promote and protect the public health,
welfare and safety by regulating outdoor signs of all types. It is intended to
protect property values, create a more attractive economic and business
climate, and to enhance and protect the physical appearance of the community.
It is further intended to reduce sign or advertising distraction and
obstructions that may contribute to traffic accidents, reduce hazards that may
be caused by signs overhanging or projecting over public rights of way, curb
the deterioration of the natural environment and enhance community development.
(Ord. 2696-95. Passed 1-4-95.)
1325.02 DEFINITIONS.
   As used in this chapter:
   (a)   "Advertisement" includes all information other than a business or
individual's name, telephone number and reason for the sign such as "For Sale",
"Siding Being Done By", "House Being Constructed By", or other similar reasons.
   (b)   "Billboard" applies to and includes structures for advertising
purposes and display boards, fences and screens used as such, having an area of
at least 100 square feet and used for placing letters or illustrations painted,
printed, cut or pasted thereon.
   (c)   "Block" means a square, but shall be held to embrace only that part of
a street bounding the square which lies between the two nearest intersections
intersecting streets on each side thereon.
   (d)   "Permanent signs" applies to and includes structures for advertising
purposes and display boards, fences and screens used as such, having an area of
less than 100 square feet and used for placing letters or illustrations
painted, printed, cut or pasted thereon.
   (e)   "Roof signs" means any billboard, permanent or temporary sign located
on or attached to roofs of structure. (Ord. 2695-95. Passed 1-4-95.)
   (f)   "Temporary accessory signs" applies to signs no more than 16 square
feet advertising a price, special, etc., which is in conjunction with the
allowable use of the property; or to signs which issue information or warnings
to person not to use private property for certain reasons, such as “No
Parking”, etc.
      (Ord. 2992-06. Passed 7-18-06.)
   (g)   "Temporary signs" applies to display boards of no more than thirty-two
square feet and is used for placing letters or illustrations, painted, printed,
cut or pasted thereof.
   (h)   "Temporary yard signs" applies to home improvement signs, house for
sale or for lease signs, construction signs, political campaign or issues signs
and garage sale signs.
   (i)   "Information signs" applies to semi-permanent signs less than 16
square feet which issue information or warnings such as "Beware of Dog", "No
Parking", etc.
      (Ord. 2696-95. Passed 1-4-95.)
1325.03 GENERAL REQUIREMENTS.
   (a)   In all districts, no permanent signs, temporary signs, temporary
accessory signs, roof signs, temporary yard signs and information signs, other
than political campaign or issues signs, shall be permitted which direct
attention through advertising as defined in this chapter to a business or
service which is conducted elsewhere than on the lot where the sign is located.
   (b)   No signs shall extend over a sidewalk or other public way, nor be
placed in Village rights of way, including devil strips, and this shall include
all home improvement, for sale or lease, political campaign signs and garage
sale signs.
   (c)   No sign shall be higher than the building height which the sign
serves, with the exception of a roof sign, which shall not extend beyond five
feet from the lowest point of the roof.
   (d)    No signs shall employ any parts or elements which flash or make use
of intermittent illumination to attract attention. This does not apply to any
sign performing a public service function indicating time, temperature, stock
market quotations or similar service, nor does it apply to districts zoned IA
or IB.
   (e)   A sign shall be removed by the owner or lessee of the sign when the
business which it advertises is no longer being conducted on the premises.
   (f)   No sign shall be located as to constitute a traffic or safety hazard.
   (g)   No person shall be permitted to park or place any vehicle, trailer or
portable sign of a permanent or semi-permanent nature on public or private
property advertising the service or products at that or any other location or
directing traffic to same.
(Ord. 2696-95. Passed 1-4-95.)
1325.031 EXCEPTIONS TO GENERAL REQUIREMENTS.
   Districts zoned IA or IB do not have to conform to Section
1325.03(a), (c) and (d).
(Ord. 2696-95. Passed 1-4-95.)
1325.04 NO PERMIT REQUIRED.
   Permits are not required for political campaign signs for either candidates
or issues; temporary yard signs (for sale or lease signs; home improvement
signs; garage sale signs, information signs or construction signs).
   (a)   Political campaign signs shall be confined within private property
only. They shall be no larger than twelve (12) square feet in size. They shall
not be permitted in any Village right of way or on Village-owned property, and
shall not be illuminated in any way.
      (Ord. 3039-08. Passed 8-20-08.)   
   (b)   For sale or lease real estate signs shall be permitted with only one
sign in the front yard, or two if a corner lot, one facing each street. These
signs shall be no larger than sixteen square feet and shall not be illuminated
in any way. Directional signs for open announcements will be permitted, but
shall not be placed on utility poles nor on private property without the
owner's consent, or on trees in the Village rights of way, including the devil
strips. They shall be valid up to the day following the open house.
   (c)   Garage sale signs shall be permitted with only one sign permitted in
the front yard where the sale is being held. Directional signs shall be
permitted, but not on utility poles nor on trees in the Village rights of way,
nor on private property without the owner's consent. These signs shall be no
larger than six square feet and are not to be illuminated in any way. Garage
sale signs shall be valid for a period of seven days prior to the sale and must
be removed no later than the day following the sale. This section also applies
to yard sales, porch sales and similar sales.
   (d)   Home improvement signs shall be limited to exterior work only and are
permitted in only the front yard where the improvement is being made. They
shall be no larger than sixteen square feet and are not to be illuminated in
any way.
   (e)   Construction signs, only identifying the architect, engineer,
contractor and any other individuals or firms involved with the construction,
but not including any advertisement of any product, and signs announcing the
character of the building enterprise or the purpose for which the building is
intended, shall be permitted during the construction. These signs shall not
exceed an area of thirty-two square feet and shall be confined to the site of
the construction only. They shall be removed upon occupancy of the premises.
   (f)   Information signs shall be permitted on private property only and
shall be no larger than 16 square feet. They shall not be placed on utility
poles nor on trees in the Village rights of way, including devil strips. They
shall not be illuminated in any way.
      (Ord. 2696-95. Passed 1-4-95; Ord. 2993-06. Passed 7-18-06.)
1325.05 PERMIT REQUIRED.
   No billboard, permanent sign, temporary sign, or roof sign shall be erected
or maintained unless a permit has first been secured from the office of the
Building Inspector and a fee paid. No temporary accessory sign shall be erected
or maintained unless a permit has first been secured from the office of the
Building Inspector.
(Ord. 2696-95. Passed 1-4-95.)
1325.06 PERMIT APPLICATION.
   (a)   Any person desiring a permit for a billboard, permanent sign,
temporary sign, roof sign or temporary accessory sign, shall make application
at the office of the Building Inspector.
   (b)   The application for a proposed billboard, permanent sign, temporary
sign or roof sign shall be accompanied by such plans and specifications and
location of the same as are necessary to fully advise and acquaint the Building
Inspector with its construction. If the plans and specifications that accompany
the application are in accordance with the provisions of this chapter, and do
not, in the opinion of the Building Inspector violate in any way the provisions
of Section
1325.09, and are accompanied by the necessary consents of the property owners
as provided in Section
1325.10, the office of the Building Inspector shall issue a permit for the
erection of such billboard, permanent sign, temporary sign or roof sign, upon
payment of such fee fixed by Council. The Building Inspector shall keep a copy
of such plans and specifications on file in his office.
   (c)   The application of a permit for a proposed temporary accessory sign
shall include the nature of the sign, location, owner's name, address and
telephone number, and upon completion of the application, the office of the
Building Inspector shall issue a permit for the erection of the sign. The
Building Inspector shall keep a copy of the application on file in his office.
   (d)   Temporary accessory signs, as defined in this chapter, are permitted
with no more than one sign, two in the case of a corner lot, one display on
each street fronting the lot. Such signs shall be no larger than sixteen square
feet, not to be illuminated and not to be placed on the Village right of way
and in no way obstruct traffic visibility. Such signs shall be valid for a
period not to exceed sixty days.
(Ord. 2696-95. Passed 1-4-95.)
1325.07 PERFORMANCE.
   Every person engaged in the business of constructing, erecting or
maintaining billboards, permanent signs, temporary signs or roof signs, shall
agree to faithfully comply with all the conditions and requirements of this
chapter and pay all damages, loss, expense, judgment or decrees, which he may
be recovered for death by wrongful act, for or by reason of the erection or
maintenance of any billboards, permanent signs, temporary signs or roof signs,
or arising out of or resulting from any violation of the terms of this chapter;
and conditioned further, to indemnify and save harmless the Village from any
and all claims, damages, liabilities, loss, expense, actions, suits or
judgments, which may be presented, sustained, brought or secured against the
Village on account of the construction or maintenance of any such billboard,
permanent sign, temporary sign or roof sign.
(Ord. 2696-95. Passed 1-4-95.)
1325.08 NAME OF OWNER TO BE PLACED ON BILLBOARD.
   The name of the person, owning or in the possession, charge or control of
any billboard, permanent sign, temporary sign or roof sign, shall be placed
upon such billboard, permanent sign, temporary sign or roof sign during the
maintenance thereof.
(Ord. 2696-95. Passed 1-4-95.)
1325.09 PROHIBITIONS.
   No person shall erect, construct or maintain, or cause to be erected,
constructed or maintained, any billboard, permanent sign, temporary sign or
roof sign in such manner as to be dangerous to the public by falling or being
blown; or constructed of such materials or dimensions as to be dangerous, or
placed upon buildings or structures in such a manner as to endanger the life or
limb of any person; or to erect the same within the fire limits of the Village
in such proximity to buildings as to increase the danger of loss by fire; or to
erect or maintain the same so as to obstruct the view of railroad crossings and
thus endanger life by accident, or to have printed upon them obscene matter or
characters tending to demoralize or injure the public morale.
(Ord. 2696-95. Passed 1-4-95.)
1325.10 CONSENT OF PROPERTY OWNERS REQUIRED FOR BILLBOARDS AND PERMANENT SIGNS.
   No person shall erect, construct or maintain any billboard or permanent sign
in any block of any street which is used exclusively for residence purposes,
without first obtaining the consent, in writing, of the owners or duly
authorized agents of such owners owning a majority of the frontage of the
property on both sides of the street in the block in which such billboard or
permanent sign is to be erected, constructed or located. Such written consent
shall be filed with the Building Inspector before a permit is issued for the
erection, construction or location of such billboard, permanent sign, temporary
sign or roof sign.
(Ord. 2696-95. Passed 1-4-95.)
1325.11 MAINTENANCE.
   All signs shall be kept in an attractive and reasonably clean manner.
Supports for signs shall be always kept in the manner originally designed for
that purpose. No wood, concrete, cement block or other similar building
materials shall be used to support signs unless they are fastened to the sign
and placed on or below ground level, or in the case of roof sign, placed on the
roof. Whenever it appears to the Building Inspector that any sign has been
erected in violation of any provision of this chapter, or is in such a
condition as to be a menace to the safety or health of the public, or has been
erected or maintained in violation of any of the provisions in this chapter, he
shall issue a notice in writing to the owner or person in charge, possession or
control thereof, if the whereabouts of such person is known, informing him of
the violation and of the dangerous condition of the sign and directing him to
make such alterations or repairs, or to do such things as are necessary to
place the structure in a safe, substantial and secure condition and to make it
comply with the requirements of this chapter within such reasonable time as
shall be stated in the notice, which time period shall not exceed ten days. If
the owner or person in charge, possession or control of the sign cannot be
found, then the Building Inspector shall attach, or cause to be attached to
such structure, a notice of the same import.
(Ord. 2696-95. Passed 1-4-95.)
1325.12 FAILURE TO COMPLY; REMOVAL OR REPAIR BY MUNICIPALITY.
   Upon failure by any person to comply with the notice to repair a dangerous
condition within the time specified, the Building Inspector may cause such sign
or portion thereof as is constructed or maintained in violation of this chapter
to be torn down. However, nothing herein contained shall prevent the Building
Inspector from adopting such precautionary measures as may be necessary or
advisable in case of imminent danger, to place such structure in a safe
condition. Such expense shall be paid by the owner, or person in charge or
control of the sign, or recovered against him.
(Ord. 2696-95. Passed 1-4-95.)
1325.13 FUTURE SIGNS.
   The provisions of this entire chapter shall apply to all signs erected
hereafter and also so far as the same are applicable and may be legally done,
to existing signs.
(Ord. 2696-95. Passed 1-4-95.)
1325.14 EXCEPTIONS.
   In all districts, the following types of signs are exempt from securing a
permit. However, the regulation as specified shall apply:
   (a)   Institutional. Signs setting forth the name of any single announcement
for any public, charitable, educational or religious institution located
entirely within the premises and civic historical interest signs and the like.
      (Ord. 2696-95. Passed 1-4-95.)
1325.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever owns, operates or maintains, or is in charge, possession or control
of any sign within the Village who neglects or refuses to comply with any
provision of this chapter or the lawful requirements of the Building Inspector,
or who erects, constructs or maintains any such structure that does not comply
with the provisions of this chapter, with the exception of the time limits in
which certain signs are to be removed, shall be fined not more than one hundred
dollars ($100.00).
   (a)   Each and every day during which such illegal erection, construction,
reconstruction, enlargement, change, maintenance or use continues may be deemed
a separate offense.
   (b)   Failure to comply with the removal time limits set forth in Sections
1325.03,
1325.04 and
1325.06 shall result in the owner of the sign being fined not less than twenty-
five dollars ($25.00) per day the sign(s) remain in violation of this chapter.
      (Ord. 2696-95. Passed 1-4-95.)

1329.01  PERMIT REQUIRED.
   Prior to the installation of aluminum siding on any structure in the
Municipality, the owners or contractor shall make application for a building
permit.
(Ord. 833-61. Passed 4-4-61.)
1329.02 GROUNDING.
   All aluminum siding installations to structures in the Municipality, shall
be grounded as a safety factor to protect public safety, health and general
welfare, and the following standards are hereby adopted:
   The entire perimeter of structure shall be grounded on opposite ends.
   (a)    Aluminum mesh shall be installed on all corners for continuity of
ground 10 feet high from grade level.
   (b)    Ground to street side of water meter.
   (c)    Ground to nearest cold water line for opposite end grounding.
   (d)    Install ground jumper for "c" to street side of water meter.
   (e)    3/4" ground rod driven into ground 8 feet will be allowed by special
permission of the Building Inspector.
      Material approved:
         Aluminum mesh 2' x 10'
         1/4" cadmium plated bolt
         1/4" pan head aluminum screws
         #6 ground wire      
         Ground clamps to water pipes
         Rod 3/4" x 8'. (Ord. 833-61. Passed 4-4-61.)
1329.03 INSPECTIONS.
   The owners or contractor of the structure being covered by aluminum siding
shall at proper times in the progress of the installation notify the Building
Inspector so that proper inspection can be made of the requirements of Section
1329.02.
(Ord. 833. Passed 4-4-61.)
   
1329.04 FEE.
   The fee to be paid prior to the issuance of a building certificate for the
purpose of defraying the costs of inspections for installation of aluminum
siding is as provided in Section
1113.02.
1329.99 PENALTY.
   (EDITOR'S NOTE: See Section
1301.99 for general Building Code penalty.)

1333.01 NEW CONSTRUCTION.
   All new construction roof drains, foundation drains and other clean water
connections must discharge to the surface water drainage system directly or
through a sump pump installation. (Ord. 1182-72. Passed 6-20-72.)
1333.99 PENALTY.

one hundred dollars ($100.00). A separate offense shall be deemed committed
each day during or on which such illegal discharge occurs or continues.
(Ord. 1182-72. Passed 6-20-72.)
CHAPTER 1335
Special Purpose Flood Damage Reduction
1335.01   General provisions.
